New Records: Virat Kohli hit his 50th ODI century, a world record going past Sachin Tendulkar
Mohammed Shami picked up 50 wickets in World Cup cricket in just 17 innings, the quickest by anyone in history
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill put on a 50-run partnership in the first 6 overs
Virat Kohli fell for 117 off 113 balls
Shreyas Iyer hit a hundred off 70 balls
Daryl Mitchell made a century for New Zealand, his fifth in 2023
Ravindra Jadeja took a brilliant direct hit to dismiss Steve Smith
Mohammed Shami dropped Kane Williamson but then picked up 5 wickets for 1 run in his next 6 balls
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma said the pitch looks good, on the slower side
Kane Williamson said they would've liked to bat first on a used surface
India's coach said India batters need to watch out for extra swing if they chase
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed pride in his team's performance
Rohit Sharma said winning the semi-final was a great feeling
Shreyas Iyer said he was happy to contribute to the team's win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Wankhede, Mumbai, with a used pitch and no dew
New Zealand's Kane Williamson and Daryl Mitchell put on a 150-run partnership in the middle overs
India's Mohammed Shami picked up 5 wickets for 1 run in his next 6 balls after dropping Kane Williamson
